result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron Lee Waupoose was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No contact with victim, CAB, or Cudahy High School.
- No contact with firearms.

- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.

supervisions.notes: With credit for one day time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation on Count 1. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Byron Lee Waupoose

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 4:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as amended and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded.  State compliant with victim notification.  Statements made by the State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for -0- days time served.  STRAIGHT TIME.

Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 10 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- Complete Parenting Classes.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with victim, CAB,  or Cudahy High School.
- Seek and maintain full-time employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample during the term of probation.
- Pay all supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.


AS TO COUNT 4:  Court sentenced the Defendant to serve one day in the House of Correction with credit for one day time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge during the period of probation on Count 1. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 


Filed:  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Byron Lee Waupoose.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 amended to Misdemeanor Battery contrary to Wis. Stats. Section 940.19(1) and 939.51)3)(a) and Count 4 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to Wis. Stats. Section 947.01(10 and 939.51(3)(b).
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea received and filed.  bm
Letter to the regarding submission of character letters received and filed.  bm
Jury Instructions received and filed.  bm
Character Letters received and filed.  bm

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court.  Attorney Peter John Heflin in court for Byron Lee Waupoose.  Prosecuting attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 10-7-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to the Court advising Attorney Peter Heflin will be appearing on behalf of Attorney Cherella received and filed.  bm

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Defense requests a scheduling conference date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Cudahy Officer Z. Desmet. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading and requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Arraignment scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Byron Lee Waupoose appeared by video means with Attorney. 
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Co-defendant case does not have counsel at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella; both appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear for court 4/20/22 due to a calendaring error.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Letter to the Court regarding Defendant's non-appearance for the Preliminary Hearing received and filed.  bm

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

03:26 PM Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 4/09/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Byron Lee Waupoose in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Borowski, Branch 12.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Defense Counsel requesting the date of 4/26/22 due he will be unavailable when the co-def next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
